remarks.para: By default, the stack trace is captured immediately before an exception object is thrown.

member.name: P:FYFY.ExceptionWithCustomStackTrace.StackTrace
member.summary: Gets a string represention that describes the function calls that led up to the Exception.
member.remarks: The stack trace representation can be set in constructor to get customs informations, otherwise, if it equals to null, the stack trace is captured immediately before the exception object is thrown.

member.name: T:FYFY.Family
member.summary: Family is a container of GameObjects which respect constraints specified by .

remarks.para: The family is updated before each FixedUpdate, Update, LateUpdate blocks of the .
The family state is the same for each system in a same block of update.
The family works only with the GameObjects known by FYFY (create in editor outside runtime or in code with functions).

member.name: F:FYFY.Family.showContent
member.summary: Show game objects included into this family

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.GetEnumerator
member.summary: Gets the enumerator over this .

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.getAt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Gets the GameObject at the specified index . Warning: this function can return null if a Game Object is Destroyed without beeing unbinded, you still have to unbind Game Object before destroying them.
member.returns: The GameObject at the specified index.

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.contains(System.Int32)
member.summary: Checks if a GameObject belongs to this .

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.addEntryCallback(FYFY.Family.EntryCallback)
member.summary: Adds callback function which will be executed when an entry occurs in this .

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.addExitCallback(FYFY.Family.ExitCallback)
member.summary: Adds callback function which will be executed when an exit occurs in this .

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.Equals(FYFY.Family)
member.summary: Check if two families are equals.

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.Equals(System.String[])
member.summary: Check if this is equal with descriptor

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.getDescriptor
member.summary: Return a descriptor of this family

member.name: M:FYFY.Family.First
member.summary: Get the first Game Object included into the family
member.returns: The first GameObject or null if the family is empty.

member.name: P:FYFY.Family.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of GameObjects belonging to this .

member.name: T:FYFY.Family.EntryCallback
member.summary: Type of the entry callbacks.

member.name: T:FYFY.Family.ExitCallback
member.summary: Type of the exit callbacks.

member.name: T:FYFY.FamilyManager
member.summary: Manager of .

member.name: M:FYFY.FamilyManager.getFamily(FYFY.Matcher[])
member.summary: Gets the family defined by a set of .

remarks.para: You get always a family that is initialized, ie which contains the GameObjects of the actual scene which respect all the contraints and which are known by FYFY. So you can parse it directly.
To be known by FYFY, a GameObject must be created in editor outside runtime or in code with functions.
This is the only way to get family reference. You cannot create a object by yourself.

member.returns: The reference of the corresponding family.

member.name: P:FYFY.FamilyManager.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of families created.

member.name: T:FYFY.FSystem
member.summary: Base class every FYFY system derives from.
member.remarks: FYFY systems have to be setted in the Unity Editor in a MainLoop's block of update.

member.name: F:FYFY.FSystem.avgExecDuration
member.summary: Gets the average execution time taken by onProcess

member.name: F:FYFY.FSystem.maxExecDuration
member.summary: Gets the maximum execution time taken by onProcess

member.name: F:FYFY.FSystem.showFamilies
member.summary: Show families used in this system

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystem.onPause(System.Int32)
member.summary: Function called when this paused.
member.param: The Unity frame number when this function is called.

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystem.onResume(System.Int32)
member.summary: Function called when this resumed.
member.param: The Unity frame number when this function is called.

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystem.onProcess(System.Int32)
member.summary: Function called each time when FYFY enter in the update block where this is.
member.remarks: Called only is this is active.
member.param: Number of times the families have been updated.

member.name: P:FYFY.FSystem.Pause
member.summary: Gets or sets a value indicating whether this is paused.

member.name: T:FYFY.FSystemManager
member.summary: Manager of .

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystemManager.fixedUpdateSystems
member.summary: Get enumerator over systems which are executed in the fixed update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystemManager.updateSystems
member.summary: Get enumerator over systems which are executed in the update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.FSystemManager.lateUpdateSystems
member.summary: Get enumerator over systems which are executed in the late update block.

member.name: T:FYFY.GameObjectManager
member.summary: Manager of GameObject.

remarks.para: You must use the functions when you deal with FYFY otherwise, FYFY can't retrieve information to maintain uptodate families.

When you call a function, the real action is done at the beginning of the next update block. This has the effect to maintain a consistent state inside a update block. For example, in a Update block, if you call the remove function on a component inside a system, the component is really removed in the Late update block. For all the system in the Update block, the component is yet present.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.loadScene(System.Int32)
member.summary: Loads the specified scene at the beginning of the next update block.
member.remarks: The scene is always loaded after closing the current scene.
member.param: Index of the scene in the Build Settings to load.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.loadScene(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the scene at the beginning of the next update block.
member.remarks: The scene is always loaded after closing the current scene.
member.param: Name of the scene to load.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.dontDestroyOnLoadAndRebind(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Makes the game object target not be destroyed automatically when loading a new scene and rebind it automatically with FYFY.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.bind(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Bind a game object with FYFY. The game object will be registered by FYFY at the beginning of the next update block.
member.remarks: In the same frame of binding, you can use it in other functions.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.unbind(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Unbind a game object to FYFY at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.setGameObjectState(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the state (enable/disable) of the game object at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.setGameObjectParent(UnityEngine.GameObject,UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets the game object parent at the beginning of the next update block.
member.param: The game object which become the new parent. This parameter can be null to reset the parent of .
If true, the parent-relative position, scale and rotation is modified such that the object keeps the same world space position, rotation and scale as before.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.setGameObjectLayer(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the game object layer at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.setGameObjectTag(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.String)
member.summary: Sets the game object tag at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.addComponent``1(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a component to the game object at the beginning of the next update block.
member.param: The component values to affect. It must be an anonymous type object.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.addComponent(UnityEngine.GameObject,System.Type,System.Object)
member.summary: Adds a component to the game object at the beginning of the next update block.
member.param: The component values to affect. It must be an anonymous type object.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.removeComponent``1(UnityEngine.GameObject)
member.summary: Removes a component of a game object at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: M:FYFY.GameObjectManager.removeComponent(UnityEngine.Component)
member.summary: Removes the component from its game object at the beginning of the next update block.

member.name: P:FYFY.GameObjectManager.Count
member.summary: Gets the number of GameObjects of the scene known by FYFY.

member.name: T:FYFY.MainLoop
member.summary: MainLoop enables: (1) to set systems into the three contexts (fixedUpdate, update and lateUpdate) (2) to define which game object binding on start (3) to follow system load and families content during playing mode

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop._fixedUpdateSystemDescriptions
member.summary: List of systems defined in fixedUpdate context through the Inspector

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop._updateSystemDescriptions
member.summary: List of systems defined in Update context through the Inspector

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop._lateUpdateSystemDescriptions
member.summary: List of systems defined in lateUpdate context through the Inspector

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop._forceUpdateInspector
member.summary: Used in FSystem to force Inspector redraw when pause is update by code

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop._loadingState
member.summary: Define how game objects are binded on start 0 means bind all game objects on start but exclude game objects defined into _specialGameObjects 1 means bind only game objects defined into _specialGameObjects

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.showSystemProfiler
member.summary: Show system profiler

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.showFamilyInspector
member.summary: Show families used in systems

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.showFamilyInspectorFixedUpdate
member.summary: Show families used in fixed update systems

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.showFamilyInspectorUpdate
member.summary: Show families used in update systems

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.showFamilyInspectorLateUpdate
member.summary: Show families used in late update systems

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.fixedUpdateStats
member.summary: How much time (ms) the previous fixed update execution lasted

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.updateStats
member.summary: How much time (ms) the previous update execution lasted

member.name: F:FYFY.MainLoop.lateUpdateStats
member.summary: How much time (ms) the previous late update execution lasted

member.summary: Base class every matcher derives from.
